flow.descriptionCdata:
fc9a637e-6a1c-426f-9d7d-5a5481c440a6.26bbf64c-4699-4331-ad77-c4dd64842bdf.description=
The operation invokes web service methods.  This operation should not be used directly\!  Please use the wizard to build flows that use this operation.

Inputs\:
    xmlTemplate - The template of the soap request to make.
    inputMap - A map used to map between template names and user-friendly names. The template names are pipe-delimited xpaths of the xmltemplate location, with a numerical element for lists.
Value format\: A list of elements separated by the new line delimiter. Eache element hes the format\: \=.
Example\: A line in the "inputMap" could be\: "Request|Details|0|Input|x\=input0.x"
    url - The url to Post to. 
    header_SOAPAction - The SOAPAction http header field, defined by many web services for indicating the intent of the request
    wswAuthenticationType - The authentication type to use for the "username" and "password" input.
Default value\: http
Valid values\: http, ntlm, ws-security digest, ws-security text
    WSSecuritySignRequest - Should the SOAP request be signed using WS-Security.
Default value\: false
Valid values true, false
    WSSecurityEncryptRequest - Should the entire SOAP request be signed using WS-Security.
Default value\: false
Valid values true, false
    WSSecurityTimestampRequest - Should the Timestamp attribute be added to the WS-Security header
Default value\: false
Valid values true, false
    WSSecurityKeystore - Keystore to use for encrypting and signing requests.
    WSSecurityKeystoreType - The type of "WSSecurityKeystore".
    WSSecurityKeystorePassword - The password for "WSSecurityKeystore".
    headers - The list containing the headers to use for the request separated by new line (CRLF).The header name - value pair will be separated by "\:".
Format\: Conforming with HTTP standard for headers (RFC 2616).
Examples\: Accept-Language\:en
    contentType - Value to be used in the Content-Type HTTP header. If Content-Type header is also passed in "headers" input, the "contentType" input will override the value provided in "headers".
Default value\: text/xml
    characterSet - The character set for HTTP Get request and response.
Default value\: UTF-8
    username - The username to use for authenticating with the web service.
Value format\: For NTLM authentication, the required format is domain\user.
    password - The password to use for authenticating with the web service.
    trustAllRoots - Enables weak security over SSL. A SSH certificate is trusted even if no trusted CA issued it.
Default value\: false
Valid values\: true, false
    useCookies - Enables cookie tracking. Cookies will be stored between consecutive calls.
Default value\: false
Valid values\: true, false
    usesJSON - Use JSON arrays for the SOAP Request for all Array types.
Default value\: false
Valid values\: true, false
    timeout - a timeout after which the connection should be terminated or 0 for no timeout.
    socketTimeout - The time to wait for data to be retrieved, in milliseconds. This input needs a value greater than or equal to zero. A "socketTimeout" value of '0' represents an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0
    proxy - A proxy to use when accessing the web service.
    proxyPort - A port on the proxy to connect to.
    proxyUsername - A username to use when connecting to the proxy.
    proxyPassword - A password to use when connecting to the proxy.
    keystore - The path to the keystore to use for SSL Client Certificates when using http authentication.
    keystorePassword - The password for the keystore when using http authentication.
    ICONCLUDE_WSW_VERSION - This value is used internally by the operation.
    returnXMLRequest - If this input is set to true, a new output named "rawXMLRequest" is returned from the operation which contains the text of the SOAP request that will be sent. This can be very valuable in troubleshooting.
Default value\: false
Valid values\: true, false

Results\:
    returnCode - This is the primary output. It contains the value 0 if the operation successfully completes and the value -1 otherwise.
    document - Raw XML response.
    documentStripped - Raw XML response stripped of namespaces for ease in parsing with XML XPath operations.
    jsonStripped - Raw XML response stripped of namespaces for ease in parsing with JSON operations, input usesJSON must be set to true for this to be populated.
    responseHeaders - The list containing the headers of the response message, separated by newline.
Format\: This is conforming with HTTP standard for headers (RFC 2616).
Example\: Content-Type\: text/xml;charset\=utf-8
              Transfer-Encoding\: chunked

Responses\:
    success - SOAP request completed successfully.
    failure - Something went wrong.

Notes\:
1.If wswAuthenticationType\=ws-security text then this operation transmits passwords in clear-text.
2.Any additional inputs that follow these are added by the Web Service Wizard, and they are specific to the particular web service method being called.
3.If you add new step-level inputs with the name header_, where  is the name of an html header, then that html header will be set to the given value in the HTTP request.
4.This operation will not allow connection through secure transport layers below TLS 1.0.
fc9a637e-6a1c-426f-9d7d-5a5481c440a6.description=
This subflow was created by the Web Services Wizard to invoke the CartModify operation on http\://webservices.amazon.com/AWSECommerceService/AWSECommerceService.wsdl. Note that the inputs to this flow which correspond to web service inputs are optional inputs.  This is due to the fact that web services definitions usually incorrectly indicate that too many inputs are required, and mirroring those settings in the flow would force you to enter unused values when running the flow.  The xmlTemplate input on the Invoke Method 2 step of this flow contains a template of the xml message to be sent, and the fields preceded by the comment "<\!--Optional\:-->" or "<\!--zero or more repetitions-->" are those which the web service indicates are optional; all others are indicated to be required.

Inputs\:
    webserviceHost - The host that is running the web service
    webservicePort - The port on the host running the web service
    headers - The list containing the headers to use for the request separated by new line (CRLF).The header name - value pair will be separated by "\:".
Format\: Conforming with HTTP standard for headers (RFC 2616).
Examples\: Accept-Language\:en
    CartModify.AWSAccessKeyId - The input named CartModify|AWSAccessKeyId of the complex type\: CartModify
    CartModify.AssociateTag - The input named CartModify|AssociateTag of the complex type\: CartModify
    CartModify.MarketplaceDomain - The input named CartModify|MarketplaceDomain of the complex type\: CartModify
    CartModify.Request0.CartId - The input named CartModify|0|Request|CartId of the complex type\: CartModify|0|Request
    CartModify.Request0.HMAC - The input named CartModify|0|Request|HMAC of the complex type\: CartModify|0|Request
    CartModify.Request0.Items.Item0.Action - The input named CartModify|0|Request|Items|0|Item|Action of the complex type\: CartModify|0|Request|Items|0|Item
    CartModify.Request0.Items.Item0.CartItemId - The input named CartModify|0|Request|Items|0|Item|CartItemId of the complex type\: CartModify|0|Request|Items|0|Item
    CartModify.Request0.Items.Item0.Quantity - The input named CartModify|0|Request|Items|0|Item|Quantity of the complex type\: CartModify|0|Request|Items|0|Item
    CartModify.Request0.MergeCart - The input named CartModify|0|Request|MergeCart of the complex type\: CartModify|0|Request
    CartModify.Request0.ResponseGroup0 - The input named CartModify|0|Request|0|ResponseGroup of the complex type\: CartModify|0|Request|0
    CartModify.Shared.CartId - The input named CartModify|Shared|CartId of the complex type\: CartModify|Shared
    CartModify.Shared.HMAC - The input named CartModify|Shared|HMAC of the complex type\: CartModify|Shared
    CartModify.Shared.Items.Item0.Action - The input named CartModify|Shared|Items|0|Item|Action of the complex type\: CartModify|Shared|Items|0|Item
    CartModify.Shared.Items.Item0.CartItemId - The input named CartModify|Shared|Items|0|Item|CartItemId of the complex type\: CartModify|Shared|Items|0|Item
    CartModify.Shared.Items.Item0.Quantity - The input named CartModify|Shared|Items|0|Item|Quantity of the complex type\: CartModify|Shared|Items|0|Item
    CartModify.Shared.MergeCart - The input named CartModify|Shared|MergeCart of the complex type\: CartModify|Shared
    CartModify.Shared.ResponseGroup0 - The input named CartModify|Shared|0|ResponseGroup of the complex type\: CartModify|Shared|0
    CartModify.Validate - The input named CartModify|Validate of the complex type\: CartModify
    CartModify.XMLEscaping - The input named CartModify|XMLEscaping of the complex type\: CartModify

Results\:
    document - The raw XML response of the web service
    documentStripped - The XML response of the web service stripped of namespaces
    responseHeaders - The list containing the headers of the response message, separated by newline.
Format\: This is conforming with HTTP standard for headers (RFC 2616).
Example\: Content-Type\: text/xml;charset\=utf-8
               Transfer-Encoding\: chunkedWebServiceWizard.repo.successDesc\=The SOAP command was accepted by the web service
    CartModifyResponse - The output given by the XPath\: /Envelope/Body/CartModifyResponse
    Arguments - The output given by the XPath\: /Envelope/Body/CartModifyResponse/OperationRequest/Arguments
    Errors - The output given by the XPath\: /Envelope/Body/CartModifyResponse/OperationRequest/Errors
    HTTPHeaders - The output given by the XPath\: /Envelope/Body/CartModifyResponse/OperationRequest/HTTPHeaders
    RequestId - The output given by the XPath\: /Envelope/Body/CartModifyResponse/OperationRequest/RequestId/text()
    RequestProcessingTime - The output given by the XPath\: /Envelope/Body/CartModifyResponse/OperationRequest/RequestProcessingTime/text()

Responses\:
    success - The SOAP command was accepted by the web service
    failure - Something went wrong while making the SOAP request
flow.name: CartModify

staticBinding.value: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:ns="http://webservices.amazon.com/AWSECommerceService/2011-08-01"> <soapenv:Header/> <soapenv:Body> <ns:CartModify> <!--Optional:--> <ns:MarketplaceDomain>?</ns:MarketplaceDomain> <!--Optional:--> <ns:AWSAccessKeyId>?</ns:AWSAccessKeyId> <!--Optional:--> <ns:AssociateTag>?</ns:AssociateTag> <!--Optional:--> <ns:Validate>?</ns:Validate> <!--Optional:--> <ns:XMLEscaping>?</ns:XMLEscaping> <!--Optional:--> <ns:Shared> <!--Optional:--> <ns:CartId>?</ns:CartId> <!--Optional:--> <ns:HMAC>?</ns:HMAC> <!--Optional:--> <ns:MergeCart>?</ns:MergeCart> <!--Optional:--> <ns:Items> <!--Zero or more repetitions:--> <ns:Item> <!--Optional:--> <ns:Action>?</ns:Action> <!--Optional:--> <ns:CartItemId>?</ns:CartItemId> <!--Optional:--> <ns:Quantity>?</ns:Quantity> </ns:Item> </ns:Items> <!--Zero or more repetitions:--> <ns:ResponseGroup>?</ns:ResponseGroup> </ns:Shared> <!--Zero or more repetitions:--> <ns:Request> <!--Optional:--> <ns:CartId>?</ns:CartId> <!--Optional:--> <ns:HMAC>?</ns:HMAC> <!--Optional:--> <ns:MergeCart>?</ns:MergeCart> <!--Optional:--> <ns:Items> <!--Zero or more repetitions:--> <ns:Item> <!--Optional:--> <ns:Action>?</ns:Action> <!--Optional:--> <ns:CartItemId>?</ns:CartItemId> <!--Optional:--> <ns:Quantity>?</ns:Quantity> </ns:Item> </ns:Items> <!--Zero or more repetitions:--> <ns:ResponseGroup>?</ns:ResponseGroup> </ns:Request> </ns:CartModify> </soapenv:Body> </soapenv:Envelope>
